skillTree.localised_description: The Lord embodies the forest; as a result of this, their warriors feel a greater call to defend it.
The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.
The Lord sets their eye upon the foe, imbuing their troops with Kurnous' spirit and the will to see his enemies destroyed.
This Lord can spot an enemy at a distance that defies belief, and demands their troops do the same.
This ritualistic war dance requires neither rhythm nor order, enabling evasion of the enemy’s clumsy attacks, and lethal counterattacks.
Once consumed by Loec’s aspect, one can instinctively evade attack through trickery, mimicking his deception of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Possessed by the Trickster God"

skillTree.localised_description: Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.
A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In the midst of battle, bow and sword are but extensions of an elven ranger, and Prince Oreon is the prime example of this. He leads his bowmen into the fray with fearless determination, no matter the odds.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +6 for Deepwood Scouts units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Deepwood Scouts units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the arrow flies farther, it may kill sooner, which is vital in the Hunt.
Nook and fire. Nook again, and fire. Nook a third time, and fire. All in a heartbeat.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
Always willing to fight on, a widened quiver allows arrows to rain, almost without end.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
By all means summon the bloodthirsty Goddess of the Hunt to assist you, but always make sure you thank her afterwards…
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

Oreon's search for his eye brought him to an entrance to the Ancient Paths of the Old Ones, hidden deep in a cave near the Golden Tower of the Southlands. It was here that Oreon got lost for so many years, travelling the world using the portals inside the web of tunnels, never able to come back to his people, until now.

effects.description: Evasion chance when using the Underway: +45%

skillTree.localised_description: From amongst his father's people, Prince Oreon chose the best archers and woodsmen and assembled this famous Elven band. He and his company earned great reknown fighting in the Southlands in the Sea Elf Lord Staleor's campaign. Through such experience, they became masters of desert warfare.

effects.description:
Attribute: Strider to all units while fighting in Desert
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Few Elves from Athel Loren have gone and established themselves outside of their forest, but Prince Oreon is no ordinary Asrai. He ventured far south and founded his own kingdom, followed by a numerous host of elves who knew him for his deeds. At the head of the host, marched his beloved band of Bowmen, always loyal, who kept order and safeguarded the kingdom even in his long absence.

skillTree.localised_name: Where I Put My Eye, I Put My Arrow
skillTree.localised_description: The ranged prowess of Oreon's Band is well known across the elven world, their deeds immortalised in songs and tales that not only the Asrai, but even the Asur and some human kingdoms have adopted into their folklore. The Bowmen of Oreon earned eternal fame on the occasion when a huge Giant Champion challenged Oreon to single combat. Oreon accepted, and as the Giant strode out to do combat, his entire company launched a single volley of arrows, killing the Giant instantly. Although many people thought this a dirty trick, Oreon always maintained that the Giant had rancid breath, smelled utterly foul and deserved to die anyway.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Hunters of the Southlands" for Deepwood Scouts units
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: No enemy presence in ability range

skillTree.localised_description: Few have seen the lights of the Paths and lived to tell the tale. There is no need however for Oreon to do so, as the tale has come back materialized alongside him, following his every step and aiding those that fight with him.

Oreon's ability with the bow is legendary amongst all the elven races, some even whispering he rivals the Shadow King, Alith Anar. After his return, the Bow of the Southlands is quiet, calmer and more steady in his behave, but his prowess with the bow has only increased.

enabled_if: No enemy presence in ability range

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

skillTree.localised_description: Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.

skillTree.localised_description: The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.

skillTree.localised_description: Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.

skillTree.localised_description: Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.

skillTree.localised_description: Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.

skillTree.localised_description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

skillTree.localised_description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

Melee attack: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.description: Vanguard Deployment||This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

factionEffects.localised_description: Having returned from his absence beyond the mortal world, the Prince of the Bowmen is back at the head of his host, ready to defend his people and to aid the Asrai in these dark times.

effects.description: Gain +5 additional Forest Health for winning battles in Magical Forests or their Heathlands
Missile strength: +8% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

Passive ability: "Champion of the Bowmen" for Deepwood Scouts units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A lone ranger entered the forest canopy at sunset. Horns sounded, as the hooded figure approached the alarmed guards. Once they took sight of the stranger, they found he was no stranger at all, and that the rightful prince of the Bowmen has returned, ready to aid his people in this dark times.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for missile infantry units
	(all units in army)

Reload time reduction: +8%
	(all units in army)
